description: It is challenging to sustain the organic growth and operation of an enterprise. Successful management requires that a CEO address a wide variety of managerial problems: namely, external uncertainty, internal complexity, organizational fragmentation, unidentified causal chain, business life cycle, organization’s excessive dependence on individuals, and employees’ accountability. This module develops a unique set of methodological tools—which have been proven in practice—to help corporate executives navigate these problems.
title: Methodology and Practice
